title: 107_s2187
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002" authorizes the Department to provide health care during major disasters and medical emergencies. The Department of Veterans Affairs Emergency Medical Care Act of 2002 allows the Secretary to provide hospital care and medical services during major disasters and medical emergencies, as defined by specific criteria. The Emergency Assistance Act allows the Secretary to provide care and services to veterans during disasters or emergencies without regard to their enrollment status. Priority is given to veterans with service-connected disabilities and active-duty members of the Armed Forces. The Emergency Assistance Act allows the Secretary to provide care and services to veterans during disasters or emergencies without regard to their enrollment status. Priority is given to veterans with service-connected disabilities and active-duty members of the Armed Forces. The cost of care provided to federal government employees must be reimbursed at agreed-upon rates. Amounts received will be credited to the facility that provided the care. Within 60 days of a disaster or emergency, the Secretary must submit a report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs. The Secretary is required to submit a report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the allocation of facilities and personnel for providing care and services. Regulations will be prescribed for governing the Secretary's authority under this section. During major disasters and medical emergencies, the Secretary may provide emergency care without charges. Members of the Armed Forces can receive hospital care, nursing home care, and medical services during war, national emergencies, or disasters. During and immediately following a disaster or emergency, the Secretary may provide hospital care and medical services to active duty members of the Armed Forces. This assistance is prioritized over other eligible groups during declared disasters or emergencies. The terms 'hospital care', 'nursing home care', and 'medical services' are defined in specific sections of the title.
